description: Describes novel low conductivity media and multipulse electroporation protocol using a NEPA21 Type II pulse generator with settings optimized to balance transfection efficiency with cell viability for this marine diatom.
before_start:
Pseudo nitzschia multiseries cultures are maintained in sterile seawater enriched with Guillard's Marine Enrichment f/2 medium and transferred during mid-log phase.

 

Electroporation Buffer

 

42% w/v 4K PEG
2.5mM Imidazole, pH 7.75

 

Additives*: 

2mM ATP

2mM MgCl2

0.5mM Glutathione

0.5mM Ascorbate

 

0.2υm filter and store Buffer at 15ºC

*Store additives at -20ºC and add to buffer fresh before each use

 

Note on additions to buffer:

We found inclusion of these additives to the electroporation buffer to ease the stress of buffer exchange and electroporation.

 

Additional buffers tried and rejected:

Osmolytes: Mannitol, Sorbitol, Tris for pH--> Reduced Pseudo-nitzschia regrowth as compared to PEG

Additives: Proline --> Increased bacterial growth, did not increase viability.

 

Recovery media following electroporation:

Sterile seawater ammended with L1 nutrients (Bigelow/ NCMA) at 1:3 NO3:Si

Additional: Kanamycin (1ug/mL) was added to the recovery culture following electroporationto in order to limit bacterial growth in culture. The microbiome of Pseudo-nitzschia isolates is apparently coupled to cell growth and physiology (Sison-Mangus, 2014). Growth is impeded following stress and culture takeover by exogenous bacteria.
manuscript_citation: M.P. Sison-Mangus, S. Jiang, K.N. Tran, R.M. Kudela, Host-specific adaptation governs the interaction of the marine diatom. Pseudo-nitzschia and their microbiota. ISME J, 8 (2014), pp. 63–76. http://dx.doi.org/10.1038/ismej.2013.138

groups.group_name: Protist Research to Optimize Tools in Genetics (PROT-G)

components.data: Collect cells for electroporation via centrifugation at 3,000 rpm, 20 minutes, remove supernatant by aspiration.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Collect cells for electroporation via centrifugation at 3,000 rpm, 20 minutes, remove supernatant by aspiration.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Electroporation of Pseudo-nitzschia multiseries
source_data.annotation: Cells fare best if they are harvested in early-log phase. Recovery following electroporation is greatly reduced in older cultures of Pseudo-nitzschia, even more so than following other manipulations.
source_data.thread_text: Cells fare best if they are harvested in early-log phase. Recovery following electroporation is greatly reduced in older cultures of Pseudo-nitzschia, even more so than following other manipulations.
source_data.body: Cells fare best if they are harvested in early-log phase. Recovery following electroporation is greatly reduced in older cultures of Pseudo-nitzschia, even more so than following other manipulations.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 1 of Electroporation of Pseudo-nitzschia multiseries
source_data.annotation: Cells can also be concentrated by filtration onto 1.2 μm polycarbonate filters ( Isopore Membrane Filters RTTP02500) and resuspended in electroporation buffer. However, this requires a pre-sterilized filtration set-up, otherwise bacterial contamination is greater than observed using the centrifugation method.
source_data.thread_text: Cells can also be concentrated by filtration onto 1.2 μm polycarbonate filters ( Isopore Membrane Filters RTTP02500) and resuspended in electroporation buffer. However, this requires a pre-sterilized filtration set-up, otherwise bacterial contamination is greater than observed using the centrifugation method.
source_data.body: Cells can also be concentrated by filtration onto 1.2 μm polycarbonate filters ( Isopore Membrane Filters RTTP02500) and resuspended in electroporation buffer. However, this requires a pre-sterilized filtration set-up, otherwise bacterial contamination is greater than observed using the centrifugation method.

components.data:
Re-suspend pellet in Electroporation Buffer (see before starting for recipe).

 

Typical cell numbers at begining log phase are in the 10*10^3 cells/mL range.  Centrifugal concentration of 100mL of culture yields around 10^6 cells for transformation. Adjust resuspension volume based on how many aliquots you will need for electroporation, (ie 100mLs to final volume of 4mLs in electroporation buffer).
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Re-suspend pellet in Electroporation Buffer (see before starting for recipe).

 

Typical cell numbers at begining log phase are in the 10*10^3 cells/mL range.  Centrifugal concentration of 100mL of culture yields around 10^6 cells for transformation. Adjust resuspension volume based on how many aliquots you will need for electroporation, (ie 100mLs to final volume of 4mLs in electroporation buffer).

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Electroporation of Pseudo-nitzschia multiseries
source_data.annotation: It is preferrable to harvest a greater volume of a younger, less dense culture if needed to achieve 10^6 final cells, rather than harvest an older, higher density culture. Look for healthy chains of Pseudo-nitzschia as opposed to single cells.
source_data.thread_text: It is preferrable to harvest a greater volume of a younger, less dense culture if needed to achieve 10^6 final cells, rather than harvest an older, higher density culture. Look for healthy chains of Pseudo-nitzschia as opposed to single cells.
source_data.body: It is preferrable to harvest a greater volume of a younger, less dense culture if needed to achieve 10^6 final cells, rather than harvest an older, higher density culture. Look for healthy chains of Pseudo-nitzschia as opposed to single cells.

components.data:
Prechill 0.2 cm gap electroporation cuvettes on ice.

Hold concentrated cell suspension on ice.

 

Pipette ca. 10 μg DNA into chilled cuvette (≤ 50 μL).  Use equivalent volume of TE for preparation of electroporation handling control treatment.

 

Add 300 μL Pseudo-nitzschia cell suspension and gently pipette up and down once to mix with DNA.

 

Hold prepared cuvettes on ice for 10 min until electroporation.
components.name: Description

Hold prepared cuvettes on ice for 10 min until electroporation.

components.data: Transfer Pseudo-nitzschia cells to cuvette and mix with plasmid
components.name: Section

source_data.section: Transfer Pseudo-nitzschia cells to cuvette and mix with plasmid

components.data:
Electroporation conditions on NepaGene21 using a 0.2 cm gap cuvette:

 

Poring Pulse: 75V, 5ms Length, 50ms Interval, 7 pulses, 10% D rate, +/- polarity

Transfer Pulse: 9V, 50ms Length, 50ms Interval, 9 pulses, 40% D rate, + polarity
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
Electroporation conditions on NepaGene21 using a 0.2 cm gap cuvette:

 

Poring Pulse: 75V, 5ms Length, 50ms Interval, 7 pulses, 10% D rate, +/- polarity

Transfer Pulse: 9V, 50ms Length, 50ms Interval, 9 pulses, 40% D rate, + polarity

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 4 of Electroporation of Pseudo-nitzschia multiseries
source_data.annotation: Pilot studies of electroporation with Sytox Green Nucleic Acid Stain (Thermo Fisher Scientifc) demonstrated maximal uptake at 150V, but due to Pseudo-nitzschia’s sensitivity to handling and manipulations, keeping a lower voltage will strike a balance between plasmid transformation and cell viability. Voltages between 75-100 will suffice.
source_data.thread_text: Pilot studies of electroporation with Sytox Green Nucleic Acid Stain (Thermo Fisher Scientifc) demonstrated maximal uptake at 150V, but due to Pseudo-nitzschia’s sensitivity to handling and manipulations, keeping a lower voltage will strike a balance between plasmid transformation and cell viability. Voltages between 75-100 will suffice.
source_data.body: Pilot studies of electroporation with Sytox Green Nucleic Acid Stain (Thermo Fisher Scientifc) demonstrated maximal uptake at 150V, but due to Pseudo-nitzschia’s sensitivity to handling and manipulations, keeping a lower voltage will strike a balance between plasmid transformation and cell viability. Voltages between 75-100 will suffice.

components.data:
Remove cuvette from electroporator and hold at room temperature for 5-10 min (until all samples have been electroporated)

 

Transfer contents from cuvette and resuspend in 30 mLFASW + reduced N-L1 [1:3 N:Si] + Kan
components.name: Description

components.data: Allow to grow at standard conditions + 1 level of screen shade until new growth is observed (by eye).
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Allow to grow at standard conditions + 1 level of screen shade until new growth is observed (by eye).

components.data: To select: once new growth is observed, spin down entire culture to concentrate. Remove supernatant. Resuspend in 0.5mL sterile seawater. Proceed to LGTA protocol.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: To select: once new growth is observed, spin down entire culture to concentrate. Remove supernatant. Resuspend in 0.5mL sterile seawater. Proceed to LGTA protocol.
